channel.title: Gem on MOK's Onomatomaniske Kaos

item.title: Installing Jekyll
item.description: If you are using Python 3 as a standard, the Jekyll installation from homebrew might give you problems, because the Jekyll installation out-of-the box uses the syntax higlighter Pygments, which does not work under Python 3. # more This is the rather mysterious error I got: $ jekyll serve --trace Configuration file: /Users/mok/github/mok0.github.io/_config.yml Source: /Users/mok/github/mok0.github.io Destination: /Users/mok/github/mok0.github.io/_site Generating... Liquid Exception: No header received back. in _posts/2015-05-02-welcome-to-jekyll.markdown Instead, use the Ruby highlighter rouge.
